channel.title: Waulter
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: PC
item.description:
Core Components
Ryzen 9 9950x3D
Vengeance 96GB 6000MT/s
RTX 5090 Astral OC
Kingston FURY Renegade G5 4TB
ROG STRIX X870-I GAMING WIFI
ROG-LOKI-1200T-SFX-L
Liquid Cooling
TG Mycro Direct-Die Pro
TG DeltaMate GPU Block Astral
TG DeltaMate Fittings
Alphacool NexXxoS HPE-30 (18fpi)
SC ResPro 120 D5
Aqua Computer D5 NEXT
Aqua Computer high flow NEXT
Aqua Computer Octo
Aqua Computer HUBBY7
Aqua Computer farbwerk 360
Aqua Computer Temperature sensor G1/4
Aqua Computer Double Protect Ultra
Aqua Computer EPDM
EK Torque Drain Valve
Misc
TG Conductonaut Extreme for CPU
TG Conductonaut
TG Phasesheet PTM for GPU
TG Shield
Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen
Cablemod cables
Accessories and Peripherals
Noctua NF-A12x25 G2
TG WireView Pro GPU Reverse
GPU Support Bracket
Aqua Computer 2 Pin
BRIEFCEC 120mm Dust Filter
Tools and Sundries
TG Ryzen 7000 Delid-Die-Mate
Step Drill Set
KWB Hole Saw
EK Leak Tester
Chris Titus Tech Windows Toolbox
M4 16mm Screws
InLine Rubber Washers
Bitspower BP-120RADH-BK
24-Pin Jumper
Documentation
Wiring
AIDA64
Minecraft Info A few words covering each component and my research considerations. You'll also find wiring diagrams and notes on other tools and parts not related to the build itself.
https://www.amd.com/en/products/processors/desktops/ryzen/9000-series/amd-ryzen-9-9950x3d.html delid for better temps and a fun challenge ordered tray version due to warranty being voided by delidding anyway best performing consumer CPU in 2025
TG Ryzen 7000 Delid-Die-Mate was used for the delid

https://www.corsair.com/de/en/p/memory/cmk96gx5m2b6000z30/vengeance-96gb-2x48gb-ddr5-dram-6000mts-cl30-amd-expo-intel-xmp-memory-kit-cmk96gx5m2b6000z30 96gb at 6000MT/s with 30-36-36-76 timings should last me a long time
https://rog.asus.com/graphics-cards/graphics-cards/rog-astral/rog-astral-rtx5090-o32g-gaming/ per-pin-monitoring
TG Deltamate GPU Block Astral support best performing consumer GPU in 2025

https://www.kingston.com/en/ssd/gaming/kingston-fury-renegade-g5-nvme-m2-ssd SM2508, low temperature gen 5 drive high TBW Gen 5 for crazy IOPS Crucial T705/T710 Samsung 9100 Pro WD_Black SN8100
https://rog.asus.com/motherboards/rog-strix/rog-strix-x870-i-gaming-wifi/ good connectivity
fits Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen and provides more space near the right and bottom side of the case for future modifications
https://rog.asus.com/power-supply-units/rog-loki/rog-loki-1200t-sfx-l-gaming-model/ short enough to fit cables/tubing beneath the PSU interface
clearance for reservoir mounting screws on the side because of the Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen's ATX sized PSU cage waiting for the SFX Seasonic x Noctua PSU
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/amd-mycro-direct-die-pro/s-tg-my-dd-p-amd
only available direct die block for Ryzen 9 9950x3D Thermal Grizzly <3 Optimus Signature V3 Pro: annoying to get and expensive to import + I couldnt find official direct die contact frames
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/deltamate-gpu-block-astral/s-tg-dm-gpu In-/Outlet placement perfect for the loop high quality product from Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/products/fittings-terminals/ minimalistic, black, high quality, low profile fittings Thermal Grizzly <3
https://shop.alphacool.com/en/shop/radiators/360mm/rad-alphacool-nexxxos-hpe-30-full-copper-360mm-radiator drain port is as low as possible due to the drain port on the rad simple black design with white logos full copper
I've guessed 18fpi 30mm to be the best for sufficient intake airflow with Noctua NF-A12x25 G2
I've chosen 30mm rad thickness to leave some space below the Deltamate GPU Block Astral for airflow 2.5cm clearance between the fans and waterblock Thermaltake Pacific CLD 360 (25fpi, 40mm): too thick + fpi probably too high for pull intake Thermaltake Pacific CLM 360 (14fpi, 40mm): too thick + fpi probably too low to handle CPU/GPU loads Watercool Heatkiller RAD 360-S (14-15fpi, 30mm): no drain port + didn't like stainless steel endcaps EK-Quantum Surface P360M (18fpi, 44mm): too thick + didn't like stainless steel endcaps
https://stealkeycustoms.de/en/products/sc-respro-120-d5-ddc-d-rgb pump positioned behind the reservoir is small enough to fit the case looks awesome
a hole was drilled into Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen to offset the pump reservoir combo
Watercool UNI 120 Acryl: visible RGB strip + leftmost lining is blocking view of motherboard components
EK-Quantum Kinetic FLT 120: too many unused ports + every liquid cooled Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen build I've seen uses it
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Water-Cooling/Pumps-Accessories/Pumps/D5-NEXT-pump::3785.html didn't consider drilling a hole into the case during research, therefore I chose pwm since vario pumps wouldn't be accesible after assembly
a hole was drilled into Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen to offset the pump reservoir combo, more on that in Bitspower BP-120RADH-BK Aquasuite support Watercool WCP D5-Vario: Vario
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Monitoring-and-Controlling/Sensors/Flow-sensor-high-flow-NEXT-G1-4::3953.html from my research the only accurate flow meter on the market Aquasuite support
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Monitoring-and-Controlling/QUADRO-and-OCTO/OCTO-fan-controller-for-PWM-fans::3832.html autonomous fan/pump controller with temperature sensors Asus BIOS independent pwm control Aquasuite support
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/USB-accessories/HUBBY7-internal-USB-2-0-Hub::3419.html
not enough USB 2.0 headers on ROG STRIX X870-I GAMING WIFI
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Monitoring-and-Controlling/farbwerk-for-RGBpx/farbwerk-360::3798.html
needed non-proprietary 5V ARGB headers for SC ResPro 120 D5 + TG DeltaMate GPU Block Astral + TG Mycro Direct-Die Pro Aquasuite support
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Monitoring-and-Controlling/Sensors/Temperature-sensor-G1-4::3126.html I'm not entirely sure how autonomous the communication between Aqua Computer devices really is
aquasuite doesn't support linux and I want a software independant temperature readout for the fan curves of the Aqua Computer Octo
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Water-Cooling/Coolant/Double-Protect-Ultra-5l-canister::3127.html I needed non-opaque liquid for low maintenance if Thermal Grizzly uses it internally I'll be using it too
https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Water-Cooling/Fittings-Tubes/System-16-10-mm/Hose-Aqua-Computer-16-10-mm-EPDM-black::4069.html
looked good and I heard it fits well with TG DeltaMate Fittings
https://www.ekwb.com/shop/ek-quantum-torque-drain-valve-satin-titanium clean drain valve
screwed into a 14mm TG DeltaMate Fittings and mounted on the bottom Alphacool NexXxoS HPE-30 (18fpi)
a hole was drilled into Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen to mount it I did a terrible job lining up the hole since I drilled the initial hole before owning a proper step drill and thought I'll be filing anyway. That's why it looks so sketch

https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/conductonaut-extreme/s-tg-ce Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/conductonaut/s-tg-c-005-r ordered 5g to disolve the soldering tin while delidding and future projects Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/phasesheet-ptm/s-tg-ps no pump out, low maintenance I considered Kryosheet and liquid metal but the benefit/risk ratio wasn't worth it for me Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/shield-coating/s-tg-ash
makes my Ryzen 9 9950x3D SMDs look all fancy Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.jonsbo.com/en/products/D31meshfupingbanBlack.html nice challenge a screen for aida64 (documentation link)
a ~68mm hole to for the SC ResPro 120 D5 and a ~26mm hole for EK Torque Drain Valve was drilled into the case using Step Drill Set and KWB Hole Saw
US: https://custom.cablemod.com/5cde38be7c5b
EU: https://custom.cablemod.com/686519e88695 their noctua colors looked the best needed custom length cables to make cable management somewhat enjoyable
had a 20% discount code from purchasing ROG-LOKI-1200T-SFX-L added a third SATA connector for a potential 2.5" SSD at the back They sent me a broken Molex cable

https://noctua.at/en/nf-a12x25-g2-pwm Noctua color scheme <3 good performing and quiet all-rounder ordered Sx2-PP versions with offset speed for mitigating alleged undesirable harmonic phenomena
the external fan at the back is for blowing air over the TG DeltaMate GPU Block Astral backplate and Vengeance 96GB 6000MT/s
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/detail/0464bdf130ed41eab3aa218bba8b219e monitoring accurate GPU energy consumption patiently waiting for the WireView V2 release Thermal Grizzly <3
https://www.amazon.de/dp/B0DQKC79F1?th=1
supports the 2.1kg TG DeltaMate GPU Block Astral and can be screwed into the Alphacool NexXxoS HPE-30 (18fpi)

https://shop.aquacomputer.de/Monitoring-and-Controlling/Accessories/Connection-cable-alarm-header-with-miniature-connector-to-motherboard-power-switch-header::3488.html
proprietary connector that connects the Aqua Computer high flow NEXT to one of the power button headers on the ROG STRIX X870-I GAMING WIFI turning the system off in case of insufficient liquid flow rate
https://www.amazon.de/dp/B097GZHR1J?th=1
Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen doesn't have a dust filter on the back
https://www.thermal-grizzly.com/en/delid-die-mate/s-tg-ddm-r7000
used to delid Ryzen 9 9950x3D
https://toom.de/p/stufenbohrer-set-4-32-mm-3-teilig/1752050
used to drill a ~26mm hole into Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen for EK Torque Drain Valve
https://toom.de/p/bimetall-lochsaege-68-mm/1752363
used to drill a ~68mm hole into Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen for SC ResPro 120 D5
https://www.ekwb.com/shop/ek-loop-leak-tester-flex well
https://github.com/ChrisTitusTech/winutil creating windows ISO images configuring windows after install makes Win11 a little more enjoyable
https://toom.de/p/zylinderschrauben-sl-schlitz-edelstahl-m4-x-16-mm-10-stueck/1651164
used to mount SC ResPro 120 D5 to the PSU cage of the Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen
https://www.amazon.de/dp/B000TFZ0LA?th=1
used to decouple SC ResPro 120 D5 from the PSU cage
vibrations in Jonsbo D31 Mesh Screen are probably pretty loud with the thin metal on metal PSU cage update: its still pretty loud

https://www.amazon.de/dp/B007N8SKK4
used to mount SC ResPro 120 D5 on the PSU cage
heavy modifications required to make the bottom bracket fit around the pump mount and offset SC ResPro 120 D5 backwards to fit accessories, tubing and fittings ontop and around TG Deltamate GPU Block Astral making it look better
M4 16mm Screws where used to mount Bitspower BP-120RADH-BK to the PSU cage

https://www.amazon.de/dp/B09PFVGH5F used to power the pump without turning on the system to fill the loop
soon™soon™16,6kg without fluid 17,8kg with fluidM.2_1 (Gen5) Debloated Windows M.2_2 (Gen4) Fedora Linux or CachyOSCPU: I did a horrible job cleaning up the cpu die after delidding I now have thermal paste all over my smds. probably some lm too GPU: I wiped the DeltaMate Backplate with an alcohol wipe (I have subtle white stripes now) Trying to screw down the PCB to the waterblock I noticed that the PCB was slightly misaligned (I had to loosen screws around the already compressed PTM on the core) After the misalignement issue I noticed that I forgot the 12VHPWR thermal pad (I had to loosen all screws again and order a new PTM Pad) I put putty on the chokes instead of the MOSFETs I ordered 100g of putty and remade it Loop: I disassembeled the loop because I had a leak The leak was at the drain port (easiest location to access) Filling Loop:
I ordered a JST 5Pin to USB A cable because I thought the Aqua Computer D5 NEXT wouldn't run on only SATA Power I realized the external psu just wasnt powerful enough D5 didn't begin spinning The pump motor was broken and eventually repaired by aqua computer Cables: Broken CableMod Molex Cable
The rgb components were fading and the fans weren't spinning since the Aqua Computer Octo reported insufficient voltage levels
I had to drain, open the loop, and pull out the gpu to get to the molex connector the cable was plugged into (Aqua Computer farbwerk 360) Display Port Cables: I ordered random uhbr20 cables thinking they could handle 4k 240hz had to order vesa certified cables
